Method Detail

sampleGreatCircle

public static List<LatLng> sampleGreatCircle(LatLng point1,
                                             LatLng point2,
                                             double maxError)
Samples great circle between point1 and point2. The great circle and the resulting points connected by Rhumb lines should differ by no more than maxError meters.

pathsBelowError

private static boolean pathsBelowError(LatLng point1,
                                       LatLng point2,
                                       double maxError)
Returns true if the rhumb line and great circle paths between point1 and point2 are (probably) always closer than maxError meters.

This is done by measuring the distance between points at the same intermediate (relative) distance between {code point1} and point2 on the Great Circle and Rhumb line. The distance between successive points used for verification is in the order of magnitude of maxError (currently, it is divided by two to avoid aliasing issues.)

Note that this algorithm is both computationally expensive and not geometrically correct: points at the same relative distance on the two lines are not necessarily the closest ones. Finding the closest Rhumb line point to a given Great Circle point (or vice-versa) is complex and far beyond the scope of this method. In practice, the current heuristic approach yields satisfactory results.

getIntermediateGreatCirclePoint

                                                      LatLng point2,
                                                      double fraction)
Returns an intermediate point on the great circle between point1 and point2.

getIntermediateGreatCirclePoint(LatLng, LatLng, double, double)

getIntermediateGreatCirclePoint

private static LatLng getIntermediateGreatCirclePoint(LatLng point1,
                                                      LatLng point2,
                                                      double fraction,
                                                      double distanceRad)
Returns an intermediate point on the great circle between point1 and point2.

Parameters:
point1 - Starting point
point2 - End point
fraction - Relative position of intermediate point (going from point1 to point2
distanceRad - Great circle distance between point1 and point2, in radians.
Returns:
Intermediate point on the great circle between point1 and point2 at the relative position fraction from point1.
See Also:
Aviation formulary

                                                    double f)
Returns an intermediate point on the Rhumb line between point1 and point2.
